title: How to Become Free from Past Karmas? | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | SB 3.22.12 | 14.08.2024
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: In material life, everyone is desirous of sense gratification.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of detachment and sense gratification in material life.
segments.transcript: To deny an offering that has come of itself is not commendable, even for one absolutely free from all attachment, much less one addicted to sensual pleasure.

segments.key_quote: Sukha Dukha, material Sukha Dukha for the body and the mind, is fixed for everybody when one takes birth.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Sukha and Dukha (happiness and distress) are fixed at birth, but not in a way that eliminates free will.
segments.transcript: The forces of the mind and the body and the senses that rise up. How we manage those things? We are given guidelines by Krishna and Bhagavad Gita, by our Acharya, by the Purvacharyas. How you conduct your life in a manner in which you handle these urges? We handle these natural, bodily, mental urges. We cannot deny that these urges are not there. Nobody can deny. We have taken this body in this material world for enjoying, so therefore the Lord has mercifully given this body, just like every karma He gives, He gives us a body according to our karma. This body has got a certain value. It has got a certain potential of Sukha and Dukha, which is unveiled, it's a function of time. Tomorrow on Sukha Dukha, day after tomorrow on Sukha Dukha, next year, 100 years from now, 10 years from now, 15 years from now, it's a function of Kala, Sukha Dukha. But Prabhupada says and the Shastra says that Sukha Dukha is a function of time. It's a function of time. It's a function of time. So Sukha Dukha, material Sukha Dukha for the body and the mind, is fixed for everybody when one takes birth. It is fixed. Sukha and Dukha is an experience. So Sukha Dukha is fixed. Not that this particular Sukha is fixed, this particular Dukha is fixed. Not that the full chart of where all you will get Sukha, where all you will get Dukha is fixed. That is not what it means. That is not what it means.

A Krishna conscious person is above duality because he does not hesitate to act in any way for the satisfaction of Krishna. segments.key_quote: So secret number one is, take authorized austerities.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of taking authorized austerities in Krishna consciousness to avoid struggling for material existence.
segments.transcript: So secret number one is, take authorized austerities. One of the things that disturb ones most in life, for everybody is what? When problems come. Isn't it? Nobody likes problems. So better we take voluntarily problems. In this material world, to preach Krishna consciousness is very problematic. To raise funds is very problematic. To convince somebody is very problematic. You need patience, tolerance, be behind him, be behind him, be behind him. Be behind him. You have to put chest. To make one devotee, right? Or you take up a project, you have to be behind it. Every problems that the karmas have in building a project, the devotee will also have to face. So all these things when we do for Krishna, it has got very high value to make our devotional life peaceful. Therefore austerity should be taken. So many times in different classes I have told, in Krishna consciousness after you have come, if you don't struggle for your spiritual, for service, if you don't struggle to control your senses, then you will be made to struggle for material existence. Struggle will not be, that struggle will not be taken away. When you struggle for material existence, it is useless. It doesn't help you in any way. It's all temporary. When you struggle for Krishna consciousness, it is giving you eternal benefit. So, where do you, suppose you say, anyway you have to struggle. If you struggle here, you will get something for this life. If you struggle here, you will get something eternal for your soul. Which will you choose? This is intelligent management. Therefore, we should struggle.

segments.summary: The speaker advises devotees to incorporate daily austerities into their lives, focusing on overcoming their default tendencies in service.
segments.transcript: We should, body and mind should have austerity every day. Something you don't like, you will have to do every day. Sadhana, something your default system does not want. There are hundreds of ways in which in our personal life, in devotees personal life, in Krishna consciousness movement that Prabhupada has given, there are hundreds of ways of picking up austerities, bona fide austerity.

segments.key_quote: In fact, the greatest tapasya that one can do in this age is to hear the holy name of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights that hearing the holy name of the Lord is the greatest tapasya in this age, despite being easier than other forms of austerity.
segments.transcript: In fact, the greatest tapasya that one can do in this age is to hear the holy name of the Lord. See, tapasya can be known, can be understood by two means. One is how difficult it is. Another is what is the result of it. See, don't mistake, always tapasya means pain. It's not so. There are authorized tapasyas. Each tapasya has a pain and a result. If you take chanting Hare Krishna Mahamantra, the hearing of Hare Krishna Mahamantra, definitely is not so difficult as standing on one leg for 10 hours. Right? Much easier. But the result of that one hearing of Hare Krishna cannot be compared to 100 years of standing on one leg. So that's what you have to understand.

segments.key_quote: That is why an Acharya's guidance is required. Otherwise you will misunderstand.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the need for an Acharya's guidance to properly understand the scriptures and apply them to one's life.
segments.transcript: Don't think that tapasya only means, you know, tapasya means authorized tapasas. Just simply you hear then you get, you know, the results of so many Ashwamedha Yajna, Shastras. Even then you cannot equal to this tapasya of hearing this Hare Krishna Mahamantra. So, we have to be very careful in understanding purport of Prabhupada, understanding these verses. That is why an Acharya's guidance is required. Otherwise you will misunderstand. Otherwise from Bhagavatam, whatever you want, you can get. All kinds of stories are there. Whatever you want to justify, you will get it. So such an all-encompassing literature is Srimad Bhagavatam. Therefore we need guidance. How it is applicable to each. And that is how I explain now.

So that the mind is peaceful, and it can execute positive devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Unless purity comes, full purity comes, we cannot be a Dheera always.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that while full purity is needed to be a 'Dheera' (sober) always, devotees can achieve it on a day-to-day basis by following the instructions of pure devotees.
segments.transcript: See, we have, unless purity comes, full purity comes, we cannot be a Dheera always. That is a pure devotee situation. But if you do what a pure devotee has told, on a day to day basis we can be a Dheera. Today you can be a Dheera, if you have done this chanting nicely. Tomorrow if you don't do chanting, you will be a Dheera. Whereas a pure devotee, who is fixed in Krishna consciousness, he is always Dheera.
